alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 6:03PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST/MIDNIGHT PDT/ TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arizona, including the following areas, Aguila Valley, Central La Paz, Gila River Valley, Kofa, Parker Valley and Tonopah Desert. Portions of southeast California, including the following area, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...Until Midnight MST/Midnight PDT/ tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Earlier rainfall along with at least some potential for additional shower and thunderstorm development this evening will continue the threat for heavy rainfall and flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Tonopah Desert
